result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Michael D Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: In the event Defendant satisfies these conditions, State will move to dismiss Count 1.

miscConds.notes: Commit no further criminal acts during the period of this agreement.

Defendant shall comply with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as a part of this case. Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted. This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

Pay costs on each count. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges granted. 30 days to report.

Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

from Defense in support of Defendant

Defendant Michael D Wells in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court reviews conditions contained in DAGPA, approves agreement. Bond continues as is.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 26, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael D Wells in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement, files Amended Information. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas on Counts 2 and 3, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 3. Court finds basis to accept plea on Count 1, withholds acceptance of plea, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
from Defense requesting rescheduling
Status conference on November 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Wells in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense filed motion for additional discovery, is missing audio/visual evidence, anticipates receiving it this week, requests additional status to allow time for review.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
for Additional Discovery
by Defendant
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Status conference set for July 25, 2016 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant Michael D Wells in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 5/23/16.
No contact direct or indirect with MT. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Michael D Wells in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 10:15 am.
